intro: Disa cardinalis, commonly known as the cardinal disa, is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, featuring linear to lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often with a contrasting dark center. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Disa cardinalis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
